AppFooter.tagline: The Global Agricultural Supply Chain Platform.

hero.title: About DamDoh
hero.subtitle: Connecting the global agricultural supply chain, one stakeholder at a time.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.p1: We envision a world where every agricultural stakeholder, from the smallest farmer to the largest retailer, is empowered with the data, connections, and tools they need to thrive.
vision.p2: DamDoh was founded on the belief that technology can bridge gaps, foster trust, and create a more equitable and sustainable global food system.

challenge.title: The Challenge We Address
challenge.description: The agricultural supply chain is fragmented, inefficient, and often lacks the transparency needed for sustainable growth. Key challenges include:

list.knowledge: Fragmented knowledge and lack of access to best practices.
list.market: Limited market access for smallholder farmers.
list.quality: Inconsistent quality control and a lack of verifiable product data.
list.logistics: Inefficient logistics leading to post-harvest losses.
list.financial: Difficulties in accessing finance and insurance for small-scale producers.
list.climate: Increasing pressure from climate change on traditional farming methods.
list.informal: A highly informal and relationship-based system that can exclude new entrants.

solution.title: The DamDoh Solution
solution.description: We are building a comprehensive 'super app' that digitizes and connects the entire agricultural ecosystem through several core pillars:

p2p.title: Person to Person
p2p.content: Connecting farmers with other farmers to share knowledge and build community.

p2b.title: Person to Business
p2b.content: Facilitating direct, trustworthy relationships between producers and buyers.

p2e.title: Person to Ecosystem
p2e.content: Giving individuals access to the entire ecosystem of services - finance, logistics, insurance, and more.

p2w.title: Person to World
p2w.content: Opening up global markets and opportunities for even the most remote producers through digital access and traceability.

commitment.title: Our Commitment to the Future
commitment.p1: We are committed to leveraging technology for good, creating a platform that is not only profitable but also regenerative for our planet and empowering for its people.
commitment.p2: Every connection made, every piece of knowledge shared, and every transaction facilitated on DamDoh is a step towards a more resilient and equitable food future.

contactPage.title: Contact Us
contactPage.subtitle: We're here to help. Reach out to us through any of the channels below.

sendMessage.title: Send us a Message
sendMessage.note: We'll do our best to respond within 24 business hours.

careers.title: Careers at DamDoh
careers.subtitle: Join our mission to revolutionize the agricultural supply chain.

whyWorkWithUs.title: Why Work With Us?
whyWorkWithUs.intro: At DamDoh, we are a passionate team of innovators, technologists, and agricultural experts dedicated to making a tangible impact on a global scale. We offer:
whyWorkWithUs.point2: Opportunities for professional growth and learning.
whyWorkWithUs.point3: A culture of collaboration and transparency.
whyWorkWithUs.point4: The chance to work on cutting-edge technology like AI and blockchain.
whyWorkWithUs.point5: A commitment to sustainability and social impact.

job1.title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer (Next.js, Firebase)
job1.description: We are looking for an experienced full-stack engineer to lead development on our core platform features.

job2.title: Agronomy Content Specialist
job2.description: Help us build the world's most comprehensive knowledge base for sustainable farming practices.

job3.title: UX/UI Designer
job3.description: Design intuitive and accessible user experiences for a diverse, global user base.

noOpenings.title: No Openings at the Moment
noOpenings.content1: We are always looking for talented individuals passionate about our mission. If you believe you would be a great fit for our team, please send your resume and a cover letter to {emailLink}.

communityGuidelines.title: Community Guidelines
communityGuidelines.subtitle: Fostering a professional, trustworthy, and collaborative environment.
communityGuidelines.intro: Welcome to the DamDoh community! To ensure our platform remains a productive and safe space for all agricultural stakeholders, we ask that you adhere to the following guidelines:

respectful.title: Be Respectful and Professional
respectful.description: Engage in courteous and constructive discussions. Disagreements are fine, but personal attacks, harassment, and hate speech are not tolerated.

authentic.title: Be Authentic and Honest
authentic.description: Represent yourself and your business truthfully. Do not impersonate others or misrepresent your products, services, or certifications.

relevant.title: Keep it Relevant
relevant.description: Contribute to discussions and listings in a way that is relevant to the agricultural supply chain. Spam, scams, and irrelevant promotional content will be removed.

fairTrade.title: Honor Your Commitments
fairTrade.description: When you make a deal or an agreement on the platform, follow through. Building trust is essential for our community's success.

sustainable.title: Promote Sustainability
sustainable.description: While not a strict requirement for all members, we encourage the sharing of knowledge and practices that promote environmental, economic, and social sustainability.

reporting.title: Reporting Violations
reporting.content: If you see content or behavior that violates these guidelines, please report it to our team at {emailLink}. We will review all reports and take appropriate action.

communityGuidelines.conclusion: By using DamDoh, you agree to these guidelines. We reserve the right to remove content and suspend accounts that violate these principles. Thank you for helping us build a great community!

helpCenterPage.title: Help Center
helpCenterPage.subtitle: Your guide to getting the most out of the DamDoh platform.
helpCenterPage.searchPlaceholder: Search for topics, features, or questions...

stillNeedHelp.title: Still Need Help?
stillNeedHelp.description: Our support team is ready to assist you with any questions you may have.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.introduction: This privacy notice for DamDoh describes how and why we might collect, store, use, and/or share ('process') your information when you use our services ('Services'), such as when you visit our website or our mobile application.

whatInfoWeCollect.heading: 1. What Information Do We Collect?
whatInfoWeCollect.content: We collect personal information that you voluntarily provide to us when you register on the Services, express an interest in obtaining information about us or our products and Services, when you participate in activities on the Services, or otherwise when you contact us.

howWeUseInfo.heading: 2. How Do We Use Your Information?
howWeUseInfo.content: We process your information for purposes based on legitimate business interests, the fulfillment of our contract with you, compliance with our legal obligations, and/or your consent. This includes facilitating account creation, enabling user-to-user communications, and providing our core services.

willInfoBeShared.heading: 3. Will Your Information Be Shared With Anyone?
willInfoBeShared.content: We only share information with your consent, to comply with laws, to provide you with services, to protect your rights, or to fulfill business obligations. For example, we share your public profile information with other users to facilitate connections.

cookiesAndTracking.heading: 4. Do We Use Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies?
cookiesAndTracking.content: We may use cookies and similar tracking technologies (like web beacons and pixels) to access or store information. Specific information about how we use such technologies and how you can refuse certain cookies is set out in our Cookie Notice.

howLongWeKeepInfo.heading: 5. How Long Do We Keep Your Information?
howLongWeKeepInfo.content: We keep your information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this privacy notice unless otherwise required by law. When we have no ongoing legitimate business need to process your personal information, we will either delete or anonymize such information.

howWeKeepInfoSafe.heading: 6. How Do We Keep Your Information Safe?
howWeKeepInfoSafe.content: We have implemented appropriate technical and organizational security measures designed to protect the security of any personal information we process. However, despite our safeguards and efforts, no electronic transmission over the Internet can be guaranteed to be 100% secure.

minors.heading: 7. Do We Collect Information From Minors?
minors.content: We do not knowingly solicit data from or market to children under 18 years of age. By using the Services, you represent that you are at least 18 or that you are the parent or guardian of such a minor and consent to such minor dependent's use of the Services.

privacyRights.heading: 8. What Are Your Privacy Rights?
privacyRights.content: In some regions, you have certain rights under applicable data protection laws. These may include the right (i) to request access and obtain a copy of your personal information, (ii) to request rectification or erasure; (iii) to restrict the processing of your personal information; and (iv) if applicable, to data portability.

controlsForDoNotTrack.heading: 9. Controls for Do-Not-Track Features
controlsForDoNotTrack.content: Most web browsers and some mobile operating systems and mobile applications include a Do-Not-Track ('DNT') feature or setting you can activate to signal your privacy preference not to have data about your online browsing activities monitored and collected. At this stage, no uniform technology standard for recognizing and implementing DNT signals has been finalized. As such, we do not currently respond to DNT browser signals.

updatesToNotice.heading: 10. Do We Make Updates to This Notice?
updatesToNotice.content: We may update this privacy notice from time to time. The updated version will be indicated by an updated 'Revised' date and the updated version will be effective as soon as it is accessible. We encourage you to review this privacy notice frequently to be informed of how we are protecting your information.

termsOfService.title: Terms of Service
termsOfService.introduction: These Terms of Use constitute a legally binding agreement made between you and DamDoh, concerning your access to and use of the DamDoh website as well as any other media form, media channel, mobile website or mobile application related, linked, or otherwise connected thereto.

agreementToTerms.heading: 1. Agreement to Terms
agreementToTerms.content: By using the platform, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree, you may not use the platform. We reserve the right to make changes to these Terms at any time.

intellectualProperty.heading: 2. Intellectual Property Rights
intellectualProperty.content: Unless otherwise indicated, the platform is our proprietary property and all source code, databases, functionality, software, website designs, audio, video, text, photographs, and graphics on the Site (collectively, the 'Content') and the trademarks, service marks, and logos contained therein are owned or controlled by us or licensed to us.

userRepresentations.heading: 3. User Representations
userRepresentations.content: By using the Site, you represent and warrant that: (1) all registration information you submit will be true, accurate, current, and complete; (2) you will maintain the accuracy of such information and promptly update such registration information as necessary; (3) you have the legal capacity and you agree to comply with these Terms of Use; (4) you will not use the Site for any illegal or unauthorized purpose; and (5) your use of the Site will not violate any applicable law or regulation.

prohibitedActivities.heading: 4. Prohibited Activities
prohibitedActivities.content: You may not access or use the Site for any purpose other than that for which we make the Site available. Prohibited activities include, but are not limited to: systematic retrieval of data, tricking or defrauding us or other users, attempting to impersonate another user, harassing or threatening any of our employees or other users, and uploading or transmitting viruses or any other type of malicious code.

platformManagement.heading: 5. Platform Management
platformManagement.content: We reserve the right, but not the obligation, to: (1) monitor the Site for violations of these Terms of Use; (2) take appropriate legal action against anyone who, in our sole discretion, violates the law or these Terms of Use; (3) in our sole discretion and without limitation, refuse, restrict access to, limit the availability of, or disable any of your Contributions or any portion thereof.

termAndTermination.heading: 6. Term and Termination
termAndTermination.content: These Terms of Use shall remain in full force and effect while you use the Site. WITHOUT LIMITING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF THESE TERMS OF USE, WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO, IN OUR SOLE DISCRETION AND WITHOUT NOTICE OR LIABILITY, DENY ACCESS TO AND USE OF THE SITE (INCLUDING BLOCKING CERTAIN IP ADDRESSES), TO ANY PERSON FOR ANY REASON OR FOR NO REASON.

modificationsAndInterruptions.heading: 7. Modifications and Interruptions
modificationsAndInterruptions.content: We reserve the right to change, modify, or remove the contents of the Site at any time or for any reason at our sole discretion without notice. We also reserve the right to modify or discontinue all or part of the Site without notice at any time. We will not be liable to you or any third party for any modification, price change, suspension, or discontinuance of the Site.

governingLaw.heading: 8. Governing Law
governingLaw.content: These Terms of Use and your use of the Site are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the jurisdiction in which DamDoh is registered, without regard to its conflict of law principles.

disputeResolution.heading: 9. Dispute Resolution
disputeResolution.content: Any legal action of whatever nature brought by either you or us shall be commenced or prosecuted in the state and federal courts located in our registered jurisdiction, and the parties hereby consent to, and waive all defenses of lack of personal jurisdiction and forum non conveniens with respect to venue and jurisdiction in such courts.

contactUs.heading: 10. Contact Us
contactUs.content: In order to resolve a complaint regarding the Site or to receive further information regarding use of the Site, please contact us.

termsOfService.conclusion: To resolve a complaint or get more information, please {contactLink}.
